onboarding.title: Welcome to AiderDesk
onboarding.description: AiderDesk is your desktop companion for AI-assisted coding. This application brings the power of Aider's AI coding assistant to a user-friendly interface, helping you:

features.2: Track your AI usage and costs
features.3: Interact with AI models in a structured way
features.4: Visualize and manage your code files
features.5: Use agentic flow for automated coding tasks and connection to MCP servers

onboarding.getStarted: Let's get started by configuring your Aider settings.

language.title: Choose Your Language
language.description: Select your preferred language for the application interface.

aider.title: Configure Aider
aider.description: To get started, please configure your Aider settings. You'll need to:

options.1: Add your API keys for the LLM provider you want to use
options.2: Set any additional options for Aider
options.3: .env and .aider.conf.yaml are also read as they would with Aider

aider.configureLater: You can also do that later in the Settings.
aider.fineTuneDescription: Advanced users can configure additional Aider settings and environment variables. This step is completely optional and can be safely skipped.
aider.fineTuneNote: Note: These settings are for advanced users who want to customize Aider's behavior. Most users can skip this step and configure these later in Settings if needed.

providers.title: Model Providers
providers.description: Configure your LLM providers for use with both Aider and Agent modes. You can set up API keys and additional settings for various providers.
providers.configureLater: You can configure these later in the Settings if you prefer.
providers.connectDescription: AiderDesk supports multiple AI providers including OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, and more. Your API keys are stored securely on your local machine and never shared.
providers.advancedUsersNote: Advanced users: You can also configure providers using environment variables in the next step's Aider configuration section.
providers.orderDescription: List of provider slugs to try in order (e.g. ["anthropic", "openai"]).
providers.allowFallbacksDescription: Whether to allow backup providers when the primary is unavailable.
providers.dataCollectionDescription: Control whether to use providers that may store data.
providers.onlyDescription: List of provider slugs to allow.
providers.ignoreDescription: List of provider slugs to skip.
providers.quantizationsDescription: List of quantization levels to filter by (e.g. ["int4", "int8"]).
providers.sortDescription: Sort providers by price or throughput.
providers.requireParametersDescription: Only use providers that support all parameters in your request.
providers.setupLater: You can also configure the providers and models in Model Library later.

agent.title: Meet Your AI Agent
agent.description: Discover the power of autonomous AI assistance with AiderDesk's Agent mode. Your AI agent can work independently to complete complex tasks.
agent.autonomousPlanningDesc: Breaks down complex requests into manageable steps and executes them systematically.
agent.toolUseDesc: Leverages various tools for file operations, web searches, and code analysis.
agent.extensibleDesc: Connect to Model Context Protocol servers for enhanced capabilities.
agent.configureDescription: Customize your default agent profile to match your workflow. You can adjust settings like tool permissions, context preferences, and behavior rules.

complete.title: Setup Complete!
complete.description: Congratulations! You've successfully set up AiderDesk. You're now ready to start coding with AI assistance.
complete.ready: Click 'Finish Setup' to begin your coding journey.
complete.success: Onboarding completed successfully! Welcome to AiderDesk.

errors.finishFailed: Failed to complete onboarding. Please try again.

noProjectsOpen.description: To begin, open a project directory. This will enable Aider to work with your code.

tips.multipleProjects: Tip: You can open multiple projects and switch between them using the tabs at the top (or CTRL+Tab).

mcpServer.configHint:
You can add multiple servers at once by pasting a JSON object with multiple server configurations.

You can use ${projectDir} in env and args to reference the current project directory.

library.deleteMemoryDialogText: Are you sure you want to delete this memory?

modelLibrary.enableVoiceControlOnlyOneInfo: Only one provider can be enabled at a time.
modelLibrary.voiceControlDescription: Use speech-to-text to dictate your prompts directly into the chat input.
modelLibrary.title: Model Library
modelLibrary.selectProvidersToViewModels: Select provider profiles above to view their models
modelLibrary.noModelsFromSelectedProviders: No models available from selected providers
modelLibrary.deleteProfileConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the profile '{{name}}'?
modelLibrary.temperatureTooltip: Controls the randomness of model responses. Lower values (0.0-0.3) produce more focused and deterministic outputs, while higher values (0.7-1.0) generate more creative and varied responses.

errors.invalidTokenCount: Token count must be a positive number
errors.invalidCost: Cost must be a non-negative number

modelLibrary.claudeAgentSdkAuthRequired: This provider requires Claude Code CLI installation and authentication. Install from https://claude.com/product/claude-code and run `claude login` to authenticate.
modelLibrary.claudeAgentSdkAgentOnly: This provider only works in Agent mode and is not supported in Code/Ask/Architect/Context modes.
modelLibrary.disableStreamingInfo: Disables response streaming. Use this when the provider or model does not support streaming responses.
modelLibrary.providerDisabled: This provider is disabled. Its models will not be available.

openai.useWebSearchTooltip: When enabled, the model will use OpenAI's web search tool to access current information from the internet.

gemini.includeThoughtsTooltip: When enabled, the model's internal thought process will be included in the conversation.
gemini.useSearchGroundingTooltip: When enabled, the model will use search results to ground its responses, improving accuracy and relevance.

bedrock.accessKeyIdTooltip: AWS access key ID. Can be left empty if AWS_PROFILE is set in environment.
bedrock.secretAccessKeyTooltip: AWS secret access key. Can be left empty if AWS_PROFILE is set in environment.
bedrock.sessionTokenTooltip: Optional session token for temporary credentials.

requesty.autoCacheTooltip: This will instruct the router to attempt to cache the response from the provider. If a similar request has been cached previously, it might be served from the cache (depending on the provider’s caching strategy and TTL).

mcp.title: MCP Servers
mcp.infoTooltip: Add Z.AI Coding Plan MCP servers to enable additional capabilities for the agent.

vision.name: Vision
vision.description: Image and video analysis using GLM-4.6V model

zread.name: Zread
zread.description: Search and read GitHub repository documentation and code

webReader.name: Web Reader
webReader.description: Fetch and extract content from web pages

webSearch.name: Web Search
webSearch.description: Search the web for real-time information

zaiPlan.thinkingEnabledTooltip: When enabled, the model will use thinking mode for deeper reasoning (default). Disable for faster responses on simple tasks.

azure.addCustomModelInfo: Models cannot be loaded automatically for Azure provider and you need to add them manually using ”+ Add Model”, ensuring the model name matches the deployment name.

hotkeys.multipleKeys: Separate multiple key combinations with commas
hotkeys.recordShortcutDescription: Press the record button below and then press the key combination you want to use as a shortcut.

voice.title: Voice
voice.idleTimeoutHelp: Stops recording after this much silence
voice.noSupportedProviders: No supported voice providers configured. Configure Gemini or OpenAI via Model Library.

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.smartTaskStateTooltip: When enabled, the model intelligently analyzes the agent's response to classify the task as 'More Info Needed', 'Ready for Implementation', or 'Ready for Review'. When disabled, the task state will always be set to 'Ready for Review'.
tasks.autoGenerateTaskNameTooltip: When enabled, the model generates a concise task name from your prompt. When disabled, the first 5 words of your prompt will be used as the task name.
tasks.showTaskStateActionsTooltip: When enabled, task state actions are displayed at the bottom of messages. Disable to hide these actions.
tasks.contextCompactingThresholdTooltip: When token usage exceeds this threshold, the conversation will be automatically managed according to the selected compaction type. Set to 0 to disable.
tasks.contextCompactionTypeTooltip: Choose how to manage conversation context when the token threshold is exceeded: Compact summarizes the conversation within the task, while Handoff creates a new task with a handoff.
tasks.worktreeSymlinkFoldersTooltip: These folders will be symlinked from the project root to the task worktree. Useful for large dependencies like node_modules.

agent.rulesInfo: You can use Rules to add specific instructions for specific MCP servers or to control flow of the agent.
agent.ruleFilesInfo: Any file in your project's .aider-desk/rules directory is automatically included in the Rules. See example here.
agent.computationalResources: Maximum number of iterations for the agent per run. Helps control computational resources.
agent.rateLimiting: Sets the minimum time between tool calls to prevent rate limiting (e.g. for Brave or other API-constrained services).
agent.temperatureTooltip: Controls randomness in responses. Lower values (0.0-0.3) make responses more focused and deterministic, higher values (0.7-1.0) make them more creative and varied. When not set, uses the model's Temperature.
agent.tokensPerResponse: Maximum number of tokens the agent can use per response. When not set, uses the model's Max Output tokens.
agent.powerToolsTooltip: Allows the agent to use tools for direct file operations (read, write, edit), searching (glob, grep, semantic search), and executing shell commands (bash).
agent.aiderToolsTooltip: Agent can use Aider to perform add/drop context files actions and run prompts.
agent.includeFilesTooltip: Adds content of context files into the chat of agent. This will increase token usage.
agent.includeRepoMapTooltip: Include the repository map from Aider in the agent's context. This can help the agent understand the project structure, but will increase token usage.
agent.selectOrCreateProfile: Select or create new agent profile
agent.bashToolAllowedPatternTooltip: Commands that match these Regex patterns separated by ; can be executed without approval
agent.bashToolDeniedPatternTooltip: Commands that match these Regex patterns separated by ; will always be denied execution
agent.includeTodoToolsTooltip: Allows the agent to manage a list of todo items, including setting, getting, updating, and clearing them.

subagent.title: Subagent
subagent.enableAsSubagentInformation: When enabled, this profile is available as a subagent to other agents.
subagent.canUseSubagentsInformation: When enabled, this agent can use subagents.
subagent.contextMemoryTooltip: Controls how much of the previous conversation context is remembered by the subagent. 'Full Context' maintains all previous subagents history, 'Last Message' only uses the final messages from previous subagent runs, and 'Off' starts fresh each time.
subagent.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe this subagent's purpose, capabilities, and specialization and when this subagent should be invoked
subagent.systemPromptPlaceholder: Your subagent's system prompt goes here. This can be multiple paragraphs and should clearly define the subagent's role, capabilities, and approach to solving problems.
subagent.invocationModeOnDemandInformation: Subagent is only used when explicitly requested by the user.
subagent.invocationModeAutomaticInformation: Subagent can be automatically invoked when appropriate by the agent.
subagent.descriptionRequiredForAutomatic: Description needs to be set in order to use this subagent automatically, otherwise the subagent can only be used when explicitly requested by the user.
subagent.on-demand: Used as subagent on user demand

agent.noProfilesInContext: No profiles found in this context
agent.resetProfileConfirm: This will restore '{{name}}' to its original default settings. Any custom modifications will be lost.

aider.envVarsPlaceholder:
#################
# LLM parameters:
#
# Include xxx_API_KEY parameters and other params needed for your LLMs.
# See https://aider.chat/docs/llms.html for details.

## OpenAI
#OPENAI_API_KEY=

## Anthropic
#ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=
aider.optionsDocumentation: Check the documentation for available options at
aider.envVarsDocumentation: Check the documentation for environment variables at
aider.addRuleFiles: Add rule files from project's <file>.aider-desk/rules</file> directory as read-only files.

aiderRestartConfirm.title: Restart Required
aiderRestartConfirm.message: Changes to Aider options or environment variables require a restart of the Aider task to take effect. Would you like to restart now?

models.title: Model Providers
models.description: Configure your LLM providers for use with both Aider and Agent modes. Click on a provider card to configure API key and additional settings.
models.additionalProvidersInfo: You can configure additional LLM providers for Aider by setting environment variables in the <aiderTab>Aider settings</aiderTab>.

vertexAi.projectPlaceholder: Enter your Google Cloud project ID
vertexAi.credentialsPlaceholder: Enter your Google Cloud credentials JSON

about.newAiderVersionAvailable: New Aider version ({{version}}) is available - restart AiderDesk to install.
about.newAiderDeskVersionReady: A new version is ready. Restart AiderDesk to apply the update.

promptBehavior.title: Prompt Behavior
promptBehavior.onlyWhenTabPressed: Only when TAB key is pressed
promptBehavior.useVimBindingsTooltip: Enable Vim key bindings for navigating and editing text in the prompt field.

server.description: Enable server on port 24337 to access AiderDesk from external applications
server.enableBasicAuthDescription: Require username and password for browser access and API calls
server.tunnelDescription: Create a Cloudflare tunnel to securely access your server from external networks. Make sure to use Authentication when exposing the server externally.

messages.title: Message Display
messages.virtualizedRenderingTooltip: Experimental feature that can improve performance when you have many messages in your conversation history by only rendering visible messages.

memory.description: Configure AI memory features to enhance conversation continuity and context retention across sessions.

enabled.label: Enable
enabled.description: Enable AI memory to remember important information across conversations and sessions.

provider.label: Embedding Provider
provider.description: Choose the embedding provider to use for memory functionality

maxDistance.label: Relevance threshold
maxDistance.description: Higher values retrieve more (and less relevant) memories. Lower values retrieve fewer (and more relevant) memories.

messages.taskInterruptedDescription: The task was interrupted by the user while in progress.
messages.exportNotAvailableWithVirtualized: Export to image is not available when using virtualized message rendering. Change to standard rendering in Settings -> General -> Message Display.

errors.frozenMessage: Aider process seems to be frozen. Would you like to restart the task?
errors.removeMessageFailed: Failed to remove message - please try again
errors.forkTaskFailed: Failed to fork task - please try again
errors.removeMessagesUpToFailed: Failed to remove messages - please try again

dialogs.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this?
dialogs.projectPathPlaceholder: Type the path to your project or use icon to browse
dialogs.cantOpenProject: This project can not be opened.

modeTooltip.code: Direct code generation and editing with Aider AI assistant
modeTooltip.agent: Autonomous AI agent with advanced reasoning and tool usage capabilities
modeTooltip.ask: Ask questions about your codebase without making changes
modeTooltip.architect: High-level project planning and architecture design
modeTooltip.context: Search and explore your codebase context
modeTooltip.bmad: Guided workflows for planning, spec'ing, and implementing features

placeholder.filesAndDirectories: Enter file or directory to add

placeholderFinish.filesOnly: Enter file or press Enter to finish
placeholderFinish.directoriesOnly: Enter directory or press Enter to finish
placeholderFinish.filesAndDirectories: Enter file or directory or press Enter to finish

contextFiles.title: Context Files
contextFiles.addFileTooltip: Add file (use Ctrl/Cmd to add as Read-only)
contextFiles.addFileTooltip.ctrl: Add file (use Ctrl to add as Read-only)
contextFiles.addFileTooltip.cmd: Add file (use Cmd to add as Read-only)
contextFiles.useGitEnabled: Git enabled - Click to use filesystem
contextFiles.useGitDisabled: Filesystem enabled - Click to use Git

aiderMode.description: Add files here that you want to read or modify. Aider can only access files that are in the context.
aiderMode.hint: Tip: Add related files (imports, types) for better understanding.

agentMode.description: The agent can access any file in your project using tools. Adding files here is optional but can speed up tasks by providing immediate context.
agentMode.hint: Tip: Add files here when using Aider tools or when you want file contents included in the prompt.
agentMode.includeContextFiles: When 'Include Context Files' is enabled in agent settings, file contents are embedded directly in the prompt for immediate access.

modelSelector.searchPlaceholderOrCustom: Search models or enter custom name...
modelSelector.invalidModelSelection: Invalid format of the model. Expected format is 'provider/model', e.g. 'openai/gpt-4'.
modelSelector.providerNotSupported: Provider '{{provider}}' is not supported. Supported providers are: {{providers}}.

mcp.loadToolsError: Failed to load MCP server tools
mcp.noToolsFound: No tools could be found. Check your configuration.

todo.title: Todos
todo.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this todo item?

costInfo.contextCompactingThresholdTooltip: When token usage exceeds this threshold, the conversation will be automatically compacted to save space.

aider.noChanges: Aider did not make any changes.

memory.noMemoriesFound: No relevant memories have been found.
memory.noRelevantMemories: No relevant memories have been found
memory.deleteDialogText: Are you sure you want to delete this memory?

diffViewer.noChanges: No changes have been made. Content is identical.

promptField.autoApproveTooltip: When enabled, automatically approve tool executions without asking for confirmation
promptField.autoApproveLockTooltip: Locking keeps Auto Approve enabled for newly created tasks

agentProfiles.title: Agents
agentProfiles.profileDescriptionPlaceholder: Describe this agent profile (purpose, tools, etc.)

projectBar.editFormatTooltip: This is the format used for editing code. Changing it might cause the model to not perform as expected.

workingMode.confirmLocalMessage:
Warning: This worktree has unsaved work:
{{warnings}}

Removing the worktree will delete this work. If you want to keep this work, use Merge action to merge it to the main branch first.

Are you sure you want to continue and remove the worktree?

workingModeTooltip.local: Make changes directly in the local project directory for this task
workingModeTooltip.worktree: Use git worktree to make isolated changes for this task

reasoningEffort.label: Reasoning effort
reasoningEffort.tooltip: Reasoning effort determines how much the model will think before taking action. High reasoning effort means the model will think more before taking action, but will also take longer to respond.

commands.agent: Switch to agent mode. If already in agent mode, opens the agent model selector. Any text after the command is used as a prompt
commands.architect: Switch to architect mode. Architect mode is used to plan changes to the code base and execute them
commands.ask: Switch to ask mode. Ask questions about the code base without editing any files
commands.clear-logs: Remove only log messages from chat
commands.code: Switch to code mode. Ask for changes to your code
commands.commit: Commit unstaged changes to the repo
commands.context: Switch to context mode. Ask for changes and Aider will add relevant files to the context
commands.copy-context: Copy the current chat context as markdown, suitable to paste into a web UI
commands.drop: Remove files from the context to free up context space
commands.init: Initializes AGENTS.md rule file with project information
commands.map: Print out the current repository map
commands.map-refresh: Force a refresh of the repository map
commands.read-only: Add files to the chat that are for reference only, or turn added files to read-only
commands.reasoning-effort: Set the reasoning effort level (values: minimal/low/medium/high depending on model)
commands.reset: Drop all files and clear the chat history
commands.run: Run a shell command and optionally add the output to the chat
commands.test: Run a predefined test command and add the output to the chat on non-zero exit code
commands.think-tokens: Set the thinking token budget (supports formats like 8096, 8k, 10.5k, 0.5M)
commands.tokens: Report on the number of tokens used by the current chat context
commands.undo: Undo the last git commit if it was done by Aider
commands.web: Scrape a webpage and save it to a file. Use /web url [file] with optional [file].
commands.handoff: Handoff conversation to new task with focus

telemetry.title: Telemetry Information
telemetry.message: To help us improve AiderDesk, anonymous telemetry data is collected. This includes information like mode usage (agent, code, ask...) and some specifics when Agent mode is used. No personal data or prompts are ever collected.
telemetry.fullInfo: Full information about what is collected can be found here.

charts.noData: No data available for the selected period

taskSidebar.title: Tasks
taskSidebar.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this task?
taskSidebar.deleteSelectedConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete {{count}} selected tasks?
taskSidebar.archiveSelectedConfirm: Are you sure you want to archive {{count}} selected tasks?
taskSidebar.unarchiveSelectedConfirm: Are you sure you want to unarchive {{count}} selected tasks?
taskSidebar.deleteConfirmWithSubtasks: This task has {{count}} subtask(s). Delete anyway?

worktree.rebaseConflicts: Rebase failed due to conflicts. Please resolve them manually or use the AI agent to help.
worktree.confirmRebaseMessage: This will rebase your worktree onto the selected branch. If there are conflicts, you will need to resolve them.
worktree.confirmAbortRebaseMessage: This will abort the in-progress rebase and restore the worktree to its pre-rebase state.
worktree.confirmContinueRebaseMessage: This will try to continue the rebase. Make sure all conflicts are resolved and staged.
worktree.confirmResolveConflictsWithAgentMessage: This will try to automatically resolve all conflicted files and stage them. Review results carefully before continuing the rebase.
worktree.mergeTooltip: Merge worktree changes to a branch
worktree.confirmMerge: Are you sure you want to {{action}} the worktree changes to the main branch? This will include any uncommitted changes.
worktree.confirmRevert: Are you sure you want to revert the last merge? This will reset the main branch to its previous state.
worktree.confirmMergeMessage: Are you sure you want to merge the worktree changes to the selected branch?
worktree.confirmSquashMessage: Are you sure you want to squash and merge the worktree changes to the selected branch?
worktree.confirmOnlyUncommittedMessage: Are you sure you want to apply uncommitted changes from worktree to the selected branch? No git merge will be performed.
worktree.mergeConflicts: Merge failed due to conflicts between your worktree and the target branch. Please rebase your worktree first to resolve them.
worktree.applyUncommittedConflicts: Failed to apply uncommitted changes due to conflicts with the target branch. Please rebase your worktree first to align your changes.
worktree.confirmRevertMessage: Are you sure you want to revert the last merge? This will undo the changes that were merged from the worktree back to the main branch.

features.title: What you can do:
features.aiCoding: Generate and modify code with AI assistance
features.contextManagement: Add files to context for better results
features.multiModel: Choose from multiple AI models and providers

tips.title: Getting started:
tips.addFiles: Add files to context using the sidebar or /add command
tips.askQuestion: Type your request in the prompt field below
tips.switchMode: Switch between modes using the mode selector below

agent.title: Agent Mode
agent.description: Use for autonomous tasks, complex workflows, and multi-step operations. The agent plans and executes tasks independently using available tools.

code.title: Code Mode
code.description: Use for direct code changes and specific tasks. Important: Add files to context to ensure the AI works on the right files.

welcome.title: Welcome to BMAD Mode (Preview)
welcome.subtitle: Guided workflows for planning, spec'ing, and implementing features

research.name: Research
research.description: Conduct comprehensive research across multiple domains using current web data and verified sources

product-brief.name: Create Product Brief
product-brief.description: Define product vision and target users

architecture.name: Architecture
architecture.description: Design technical architecture and system structure

ux-design.name: UX Design
ux-design.description: Create UX design documentation for product interface

quick-spec.name: Quick Spec
quick-spec.description: Create focused specifications for well-defined features

epics-stories.name: Epics/Stories
epics-stories.description: Break down requirements into implementation-ready epics and stories

implementation.name: Implementation
implementation.description: Guided development for implementing stories and features

resume.corruptedDescription: Artifact frontmatter is unreadable. Restart from beginning to recover.

install.autoInstallNote: Click the button above to automatically install BMAD for the current project.
install.manualInstallNote: For advanced customization, you can also install BMAD manually by running this command in your terminal.
install.terminalPrompt: Install BMAD to access guided workflows for planning, spec'ing, and implementing features.
install.autoCheckNote: This page will automatically detect when BMAD installation is complete.
benefits: Structured workflows from brainstorming to implementation

fullWorkflow.title: Full Workflow
fullWorkflow.description: Use for new projects, complex features, or when requirements need exploration. Guides you through analysis, planning, solutioning, and implementation phases.

quickFlow.title: Quick Flow
quickFlow.description: Skip planning phases for small, well-understood work. Create a quick spec and go directly to implementation.

taskActions.entryPoint: Entry point - start your project here

reset.bannerDescription: This will permanently delete all files in the _bmad-output folder. If you have a completed workflow or want to preserve your progress, backup the files from _bmad-output/ to docs/ or another location first.
reset.confirmDescription: This action will permanently delete all generated artifacts and workflow progress in the _bmad-output folder. This cannot be undone.
